intro: Diplusodon epilobioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is characterized by its slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
